it is written. Isaiah here seems to refer to a scripture that predated him, but his quotation is not readily identifiable, and the scripture may have been lost.

I will not keep silence, but will recompense. As prophesied ("it is written") the Lord would speak through his judgments and bring chastisements on the wicked (42:14; Jer. 16:18).

into their bosom. This image means close to their heart, where it hurts. The inside front of the garment was used as a pocket to keep money and personal items, and payments were kept there (Luke 6:38). The Lord promises to repay their sins in full.
